intro: Streptanthus linearifolius, commonly known as the slenderleaf whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has linear, grass-like leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Streptanthus linearifolius is often found in open woodlands and along coastal bluffs.
